item.title: GraphQL - Tools of Trade
item.description: Tools of the Trade Overview Beyond enumeration tools like graphw00f and graphql-voyager, specific tools exist to assist in auditing and attacking GraphQL APIs directly.

item.title: GraphQL - Mutations
item.description: GraphQL Mutations Concept Mutations are GraphQL queries that modify server data.

item.title: GraphQL - DoS & Batching Attacks
item.description: Denial-of-Service (DoS) & Batching Attacks Concept Depending on the GraphQL APIâ€™s configuration, we can create queries that result in exponentially large responses and require significant resources to process.

item.title: GraphQL - Injection Attacks
item.description: Injection Attacks Overview One of the most common web vulnerabilities are injection attacks such as SQL Injection, Cross-Site Scripting (XSS), and Command Injection.

item.title: GraphQL - Cheat Sheet
item.description: Attacking GraphQL Cheat Sheet Overview This cheat sheet covers basic GraphQL requests, introspection techniques to map the schema, batching attacks, and mutation examples.

item.title: GraphQL - IDOR
item.description: Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) Concept Like REST APIs, broken authorization, particularly Insecure Direct Object Reference (IDOR) vulnerabilities, are common security issues in GraphQL.

item.title: GraphQL - Information Disclosure
item.description: Information Disclosure Concept Exploiting any service requires thorough enumeration and reconnaissance to identify all possible attack vectors.

item.title: GraphQL - Introduction
item.description: Introduction to GraphQL Concept GraphQL is a query language typically used by web APIs as an alternative to REST.

item.title: XXE Blind Data Exfiltration
item.description: Blind Data Exfiltration In scenarios known as Blind XXE, the web application does not output any of the XML input entities, nor does it display PHP runtime errors.

item.title: Advanced File Disclosure using XXE
item.description: Advanced File Disclosure Not all XXE vulnerabilities may be straightforward to exploit.
